definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate

sentences.english: Babies and the chancy life of a musician do not exactly go together.
sentences.chinese: 生兒育女和樂師動盪不定的生活是不合拍的。

sentences.english: This is one of the areas where we definitely do not want them to nest.
sentences.chinese: 我們絕對不願意它們在這裏結婚，築巢，生兒育女。

sentences.english: This is in part because those good educations make having children a pricey proposition.
sentences.chinese: 部分原因是良好的教育促使生兒育女的成本太高。

sentences.english: He does not even feel guilty for procreating with Mrs. Polar Bear.
sentences.chinese: 他也沒有因爲與北極熊夫人生兒育女而有愧。

sentences.english: Most young women feel a biological need to procreate.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的年輕婦女都有生兒育女的生理需要。

sentences.english: Jim wasn't fundamentally mad about a home and kids.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆其實並不急於娶親成家，生兒育女。

definition: to carry on one's ancestral line
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to get married and start a career (idiom)/to settle down/to establish oneself
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
hard power (i.e. military and economic power)
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
to support a family/to raise a family
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
